name: European Committee for Interoperable Systems
memberOrga:
Our members are IBM, Kolab Systems, Oracle Corporation, Mozilla Corporation, Opera
Software ASA, Red Hat Inc., Real Networks, Corel. More information available here: http://www.ecis.eu/about-ecis/.
goal:
ECIS is an international non-profit association founded in 1989 that endeavours to promote a favourable environment for interoperable ICT solutions. It has actively represented its members regarding issues related to interoperability and competition before European,
international and national fora, including the EU institutions and WIPO.
interests: Competition, Consumer Affairs, Enterprise, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and Technology, Trade
euInitiatives:
ECIS is involved in the following activities:
•  The European Commission Communication on a Digital Single Market ("DSM") strategy for Europe (the "DSM Communication");
• The actions related to "building a data economy" including the European Commission's proposal for a European 'free flow of data' initiative as foreseen by the DSM Communication;
• The action related to the "European Cloud Initiative";
• The actions related to the cyber security Public Private Partnership ("PPP"); and the Proposal for a Regulation on ENISA, the "EU Cybersecurity Agency", and repealing Regulation (EU) 526/2013, and on Information and Communication Technology cybersecurity certification (''Cybersecurity Act'');
• The European Parliament Report on Civil Law rules on robotics and the European Commission Strategy on AI and robotics;
• The actions related to "boosting competitiveness through interoperability and innovation" as foreseen by the DSM Communication; and
• The European Commission Communication titled "Towards a modern, more European
copyright framework," and the various actions it foresees.
